content: your voice matters take a stand for free speech by knitting up a read banned books banner in these complicated times many nations are facing new and significant challenges to free expression free speach and access to information are fundamental human rights and keystones of democracy stay informed of your local politics and stand up against censorship and book bans craftivism ideas - while you knit a read banned books banner meditate on how you can use your unique voice interests and talents to create change in your community - hang read banned books banners in public places around your town with a tag including information for how to register to vote - gift a read banned books banner to your local library to display - gather your friends and organize a craftivism group knit read banned books banners together and plan ways you can help turn out more community members to vote in local elections some organizations you might want to support are - the american civil liberties union - national coalition against censorship finished dimensions approximately 9 / 23 cm wide by 5 / 11 5 cm tall gauge 20 sts and 25 row over 4 / 10 cm in stranded colorwork stockinette st worked flat and blocked materials dk weight wool yarn color 1 pictured in yellow approximately 50 yards / 46 meters color 2 pictured in purple approximately 50 yards / 46 meters needles size us 5 4 mm 20 / 51 cm needles or size needed to obtain gauge
